name: Sopa de Mariscos (Seafood Soup)
author: Rob
summary: A Tex-Mex inspired seafood soup with a rich broth for a satisfying Sunday meal.
ingredients: 1 ear fresh corn, kernels cut from cob
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, lime, and cilantro (such as RO*TEL®)
1 pound fresh cod, cut into bite-sized pieces
¾ pound fresh shrimp, peeled and deveined
¼ cup fresh cilantro, chopped, or to taste
directions: Heat olive oil in a stockpot over medium heat
Add onion and cook until translucent, 5 to 7 minutes
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
Add carrots, corn, and celery and cook until softened, about 5 minutes
Add chicken stock, tomatoes, ancho chili, chili powder, and cumin and bring to a boil
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes
Meanwhile, place clams and mussels in a bowl of cold water to filter out sand
Drain clams and mussels; add to the soup
Cover and boil until cod is white and flaky, mussels and clams are open, and shrimp is pink, 5 to 10 minutes
Serve immediately, topped with cilantro and avocado
